revised_title: Harwich Cliff Fossil Shells and Geological Observations
tldr: The author, Samuel Dale, describes his observations of Harwich Cliff and the fossil shells found there. He discusses the various layers of rock, clay, and sand within the cliff and the presence of pyrites or copperas stones. Dale also mentions the unique "Osteocolla Anglicana" found in the cliff's sandy earth. The author's observations contribute to the understanding of the geological processes and the formation of the Harwich Cliff.
